sen.j: 妓王（ぎおう、生年不詳 - 承安 (日本)2年8月15日 (旧暦)（1172年9月4日）?）は平安時代末期の白拍子。
sen.e: Gio (year of birth unknown - August 15, 1172?) was Shirabyoshi (female dancers who performed traditional Japanese dances, which were also called Shirabyoshi) in the end of Heian Period.
Gio (year of birth unknown - August 15, 1172?) was a Shirabyoshi (female dancer who performed traditional Japanese dances) during the end of Heian Period.
sen.cmt: eliminated "which were also called Shirabyoshi" since it seemed unecessary; changed "in" to "during"; dancers→dancer
sen.e: Gio (year of birth unknown - September 11, 1172?) was a Shirabyoshi (female dancer who performed traditional Japanese dances) during the end of Heian Period.
sen.cmt: 旧暦日付を変換グレゴリオ暦に変換

sen.e: She was born in Omi Province.
She was born in Omi Province.
She was born in Omi Province.
Gio '妓王' can be also written as '祇王' in Japanese.

sen.j: 伊勢平氏の家人・江部九郎時久の娘。
sen.e: She was the daughter of 江部九郎時久, a Kenin (retainer) of Ise-Heishi (Taira clan.)
sen.cmt: 「江部九郎時久」は、読み方不明のため、訳出できませんでした。
sen.e: Gio was the daughter of 江部九郎時久, a Kenin (retainer) of the Ise-Heishi (Taira clan).
sen.cmt: changed "She" to "Gio" since this is a new paragraph; added "the" before "Ise-Heishi"; moved period to after parenthesis
sen.e: Gio was the daughter of 江部九郎時久, a Kenin (retainer) of the Ise-Heishi (Taira clan).

sen.j: 近江国祇王村（現・滋賀県野洲市）に生まれる。
sen.e: She was born in Gio Village, Omi Province (in present-day Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture.)
She was born in Gio Village in Omi Province (present-day Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture.)
She was born in Gio Village in Omi Province (present-day Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture.)

sen.j: その生誕の地には妓王の菩提を弔うために建てられた妓王寺が現存する。
sen.e: In her birthplace exists Gio-ji Temple that was built to pray to Buddha for the happiness of the dead Gio.
The still-standing Gio-ji Temple was built where Gio was born in order to pray to the Buddha for her happiness.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally
sen.e: The still-standing Gio-ji Temple was built where Gio was born in order to pray to the Buddha for her happiness.

sen.j: 母の刀自、妹の妓女とともに、京都で有名な白拍子となり、平清盛に寵愛され、平家物語（第一巻 6「祗王」）に登場する。
sen.e: As well as her mother Toji and her sister Gijo, Gio became famous Shirabyoshi in Kyoto and got affection from TAIRA no Kiyomori, and she appeared in Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike) (Volume 1, Section 6 "Gio".)

As well as her mother Toji and her sister Gijo, Gio became a famous Shirabyoshi in Kyoto, gaining the affection of TAIRA no Kiyomori, as well as appearing in Heike Monogatari (The Tale of the Heike) (Volume 1, Section 6 "Gio").
sen.cmt: added "a" before "famous"; fixed grammar; moved period to after parenthesis
sen.e: As well as her mother Toji and her sister Gijo, Gio became a famous Shirabyoshi in Kyoto, gaining the affection of TAIRA no Kiyomori, as well as appearing in Heike Monogatari (The Tale of the Heike) (Volume 1, Section 6 'Gio').

sen.j: 干ばつで苦しむ故郷の村人を救うために、生まれ故郷の野洲に水路を作るよう清盛に頼んだ。
sen.e: To save the village people suffering from a drought, she asked Kiyomori to build a water channel in her hometown Yasu.
To save villagers who were suffering from a drought, Gio asked Kiyomori to build a water channel in her hometown Yasu.
sen.cmt: changed "the village people" to "villagers"; changed "she" to "Gio"
sen.e: To save villagers who were suffering from a drought, Gio asked Kiyomori to build a water channel in her hometown Yasu.

sen.j: そして、その川は祇王井川と呼ばれ現存する。
sen.e: Then, that river was called Gioi-gawa River in existence.
The river still exists today and was named Gioi-gawa River.
The river still exists today and was named Gioi-gawa River.

sen.j: やがて清盛の寵愛は仏御前に移り、母の刀自、妹の妓女とともに嵯峨往生院（現・祇王寺）へ仏門に入る。
sen.e: Later, Kiyomori's affections for Gio were transferred to Hotoke-gozen and then Gio as well as her mother Toji and her sister Gijo became nuns at Sagaojo-in Temple (in present-day Gio-ji Temple.)
sen.cmt: 「仏門に入る」は、「尼になる」と解釈して訳しました。参照サイト：http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiraby%C5%8Dshi
sen.e: Before long, Kiyomori's affection changed to Hotoke-gozen (Buddha), and Gio, her mother Toji and sister Gijo became nuns at the Sagaojo-in Temple (present-day Gio-ji Temple).
sen.cmt: やがて→"before long"; added description for "Hotoke-gozen"; fixed grammar to read more naturally; moved period to after parenthesis
sen.e: Before long, Kiyomori's affection changed to Hotoke-gozen, and Gio, her mother Toji and sister Gijo became nuns at the Sagaojo-in Temple (present-day Gio-ji Temple).

sen.j: 当時21歳だったとされる。
sen.e: She was believed to be 21 years old at the time.
It is believed that she was 21 years old at the time.
It is believed that she was 21 years old at the time.

sen.j: 祇王寺にある碑には「性如禅尼承安二年壬辰八月十五日寂」とある。
sen.e: The monument in Gio-ji Temple has the inscription "性如禅尼 died on August 15, Joan 2 (1172)" and it is believed that "性如禅尼" refers to Gio, and she is believed to have died on August 15, 1172.
sen.cmt: 「性如禅尼」は、読み方不明のため、訳出できませんでした。
sen.e: A monument in Gio-ji Temple has the inscription "性如禅尼 died on August 15, Joan 2 (1172)." It is believed that "性如禅尼" refers to Gio and the date of her death.
sen.cmt: split into two sentences to reduce confusion; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: A monument in Gio-ji Temple has the inscription '性如禅尼承安二年壬辰八月十五日寂.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: その「性如禅尼」は妓王の事を指すとされており、承安2年（1172年）8月15日に亡くなったとされている。
sen.e: It is believed that '性如禅尼' refers to Gio and she died on September 4 of 1172.
